data.description: This is the minimum speed at which the printer is forced to print, despite slowing down to the minimum layer time. When the printer slows down too much, the pressure in the nozzle is too low and results in a bad print quality.
data.img_description: An overview of common cooling settings combinations, projected onto a pyramid model.
data.hints: - For example, if a minimum layer time of 5 seconds requires the printer to print at a speed of 8 mm/s, it will only do that if at least 8 mm/s is set as minimum speed. If the minimum speed is set at 10 mm/s, that means that it wonâ€™t print slower than 10 mm/s and that the layer time will change accordingly, and would then be shorter than 5 seconds.
